reviews.author: yyyyyyyy
reviews.title: If you love teaching and wanna more lab practice, This course is ideal for you
reviews.comment_content:
" Using molecular biology techniques, students will optimize experiments for detecting specific human genetic variants in an iterative process. A laboratory manual will be composed by the students, which will be used in outreach workshops for participants from high schools. Students will be trained to give introductory presentations and laboratory instructions effectively prior to the workshops. "

So basically, you will:
- Work out with SNPs
- Learn how to design primers
- Optimizing lab protocol (DNA extraction, purification etc)
- Make a lab manual
- Do a few presentations
- Carry out a workshop

If you are a experience learning guy like me, you will love this course. Even though you have merely no lab experience, like most of us under the covid-setting. You will be fine in here.

reviews.comment_workload:
When the workload of this course is light, only need to do a few presentations and the lab manual. Especially you are one of the BIBU students, preparing slides is just a piece of cake for you.

One thing to take home is that, finding teammate who is good at present and teaching is kinda essential, so try to mingle with your classmates at the beginning of the course. You won't want a teammate who will brings negative effect to your presentation and your lab work.

But its kinda    t i m e    c o n s u m i n g  , you are expected to come to the lab to test out the protocol and primers 3-6 hours per week. Moreover, there will be a workshop right before the study break, making your study schedule extra tight.
